title: What's the difference between developed and developing countries? - Quora

response.answer_text: Definitions from Wikipedia: Developed country A developed country, industrialized country, or "more economically developed country" (MEDC), is a sovereign state that has a highly developed economy and advanced technological infrastructure relative to other less industrialized nations. Most commonly, the criteria for evaluating the degree of economic development are gross domestic product (GDP), gross national product (GNP), the per capita income, level of industrialization, amount of widespread infrastructure and general standard of living. [1] Which criteria are to be used and which countries can be classified as being developed are subjects of debate. [1] Developed Economy Definition. Investopedia (2010-04-16). Retrieved on 2013-07-12. Take into account the last sentence: Criteria to classify countries is subject of debate. Developing country A developing country, also called a less developed country or underdeveloped country, is a nation with a less developed industrial base, and a low Human Development Index (HDI) relative to other countries.[1] On the other hand, since the late 1990s developing countries tended to demonstrate higher growth rates than the developed ones.[2] There is no universal, agreed-upon criterion for what makes a country developing versus developed and which countries fit these two categories,[3] although there are general reference points such as a nation's GDP per capita compared to other nations. Also, the general term less-developed country should not be confused with the specific least developed country. Sullivan, Arthur; Steven M. Sheffrin (2003). Economics: Principles in Action. Upper Saddle River, New Jersey 07458: Pearson Prentice Hall. p. 471. ISBN 0-13-063085-3.Korotayev A., Zinkina J. On the structure of the present-day convergence. Campus-Wide Information Systems. Vol. 31 No. 2/3, 2014, pp. 139-152a b c "Composition of macro geographical (continental) region".A possible differentiation can be taken as: Criteria for what is not a developed country can be obtained by inverting the factors that define a developed country: people have lower life expectancypeople have less educationpeople have less money (income)

Key Differences Between Developed and Developing Countries : The following are the major differences between developed countries and developing countries The countries which are independent and prosperous are known as Developed Countries. The countries which are facing the beginning of industrialization are called Developing CountriesDeveloped Countries have a high per capita income and GDP as compared to Developing Countries. Eg. Nominal GDP per capita of Switzerland is $ 78,179 whereas the same for India is $1,850.In Developed Countries the literacy rate is high, but in Developing Countries illiteracy rate is high.Developed Countries have good infrastructure and a better environment in terms of health and safety, which are absent in Developing Countries.Developed Countries generate revenue from the industrial sector. Conversely, Developing Countries generate revenue from the service sector.In developed countries, the standard of living of people is high, which is moderate in developing countries.Resources are effectively and efficiently utilized in developed countries. On the other hand, proper utilization of resources is not done in developing countries.In developed countries, the birth rate and death rate are low, whereas in developing countries both the rates are high.Read more: http://keydifferences.com/difference-between-developed-countries-and-developing-countries.html#ixzz4h7nuCdV0

A developed country is one where Literacy is 100%,2. Women are totally empowered, they should be allowed to study any course they desire, to study up to any level they want & should be allowed to purse any job or take up enterprise they want, should be allowed to drive, travel freely, get elected etc - in short no restrictions of any kind in any sphere what soever. 3. Nobody should be under the poverty line. That every person should be in a position to get 2 square meals a day. No person should sleep hungry. 4. There has to be free access to doctors, dispensaries, hospitals so that a citizen’s disease, ailment, health problems can be addressed. Unless he is healthy, he cannot contribute to self, family, society & the country. 5. All citizens should have free access to pure & potable drinking water at all times. If any of the criteria is not fulfilled, a country cannot be called a developed one.

Economic view _when a country have greater GNP than GDP.G GNP= GDP- NIA(NET INCOME FROM ABROAD). Now what is gdp ,so gdp is our purchase,production power.which ever we purchase or produce in our geographical territory it includes in GDP, twist is that what we purchase may give profit to a foreigner company, like oppo,gionee . In GNP we balance our profit from abroad and other foreigner companies profit from our country . If our profit or NIA is greater than we consider in developed country. If our per capita income is greater than banch mark income than it is developed country. Socio economic _ When basic needs of every person food , fabric, floor, with sex,love,care , entertainment,and chance to develop yourself( education, employment,entreprnureship) fulfill with healthy , environment friendly and sustainable use of resources. The culture and general behavior includes care of every weaker section children,older,and speciall abbled person.

Let us take an example. Let us say the world is like a corporate company. Developed country is like a top executive of the corporate company. To reach that level, the top executive had gone through many stages of progress and finally he is now in that exalted position. Developing country is like a junior manager in the same company. He has worked from the entry level to reach the management level, but has to progress through more stages yet to reach the top management level. Hope this example explains the difference.

First of all is mentality of people. People in developed world have inherently different mentality than people in the developing world and only those developing countries can become developed whose mentality somewhat matches that of in developed countries. All other specialities stem from here like well-maintained cities, good healthcare, clean roads and everything which sets them apart from developing countries.

Actual differences are many. Basic amenities like piped water supply, Good roads,Good infrastructure ,Housing, food and transport for each and every individual. Medical facilities for entire society. High disposable income for most of the people. Safety and security for all. Good policing and judiciary. You think we have achieved it all? I do not think so.. So when we look forward there are many countries better off in this criteria and worse countries as well. We are some where in middle due to a big period of hindu rate of growth.Almost four decades were lost in so called socialist thoughts and we are back on track since 1991. We will achieve it in 2–3 decades till then happy to be developing.

in developed country there is no problems related to basic need such as fresh water to drink,structured building to living,good structured road…..etc. on the other side in developing country there are basic problems…..which is mentioned on the above.
Developed country refers to a country which is highly developed at that time but developing country means a country which is developing or going to a higher level is known as developing country

tools and equipment. The wide availability and use of tools and euipment- wrenches, tractors, cranes, computers, numerically controlled machines, and robots - in the developed countries, and their unavailability and sparse use in the developing countries.
